alert.note: Alert for Clay (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 16 at 8:43PM CDT until June 19 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota...North Dakota... Red River of the North at Fargo affecting Cass and Clay Counties. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Red River of the North at Fargo. * WHEN...Until early Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, MINOR FLOOD. Elm St between 14th and 15th Ave N is closed (Fargo). Storm sewer pump stations are beginning to operate (Fargo). * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 18.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:15 PM CDT Thursday was 18.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to be nearly steady around 18.1 feet through the end of the week. It will then fall below flood stage Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
